title: Baked Honey-Mustard Pretzel Chicken Tenders
full_text:
Baked Honey-Mustard Pretzel Chicken Tenders
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
20 mins
Cook
20 mins
Cooling Time:
5 mins
Total
45 mins
Serves
4
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
Cooking spray
1 1/2
pounds
(
680
g
)
chicken tenderloins
(see notes)
2
teaspoons
Diamond Crystal kosher salt
, divided; for table salt use half as much by volume
1/2
cup
(
2.25
ounces
;
64
g
)
all-purpose flour
1/2
cup
(
120
ml
)
yellow mustard
1/2
cup
(
120
ml
)
mayonnaise
1/4
cup
(
60
ml
)
honey
7
ounces
(
200
g
) thin
pretzel sticks
or thin mini twists
1/4
cup
(
60
ml
)
extra-virgin olive oil
Directions
If Cooking in Oven:
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper, then set a wire rack in baking sheet. Spray rack with cooking spray and set aside.
For the Chicken:
Pat chicken tenders dry with paper towels and season evenly with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Set aside while you prepare the dredge.
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
Spread flour in a shallow dish. In a second shallow dish, whisk mustard, mayonnaise, honey, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt until well combined. Transfer 1/2 cup sauce to a small serving bowl, cover, and set aside in refrigerator.
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
Add pretzels to the bowl of a food processor. Process until mostly finely ground with some larger pieces remaining, about 20 seconds. (Alternatively, add pretzels to a large, heavy-duty resealable bag, press out the air, seal, and use a rolling pin to crush pretzels into fine crumbs. Note that some pretzels may break through the bag.)
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
Transfer pretzel crumbs to a third shallow dish (you should have about 2 cups). Add oil and use fingers to toss until crumbs are evenly coated in oil.
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
Working with one chicken tender at a time, dredge in flour, shaking off excess. Dip chicken in honey-mustard sauce, let excess drip off, then dredge in pretzel crumbs, pressing gently to help crumbs adhere; transfer chicken to greased rack set in baking sheet. Repeat the process with remaining tenders, then discard remaining flour, sauce, and crumbs.
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
For Cooking in the Oven:
Bake tenders until golden brown, pretzel coating is crunchy, and internal temperature reaches 160°F (75°C), 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving platter and let rest for 5 minutes.
For Cooking in the Air Fryer:
Lightly spray the cooking basket of a 6-quart air fryer with cooking spray. Transfer half of prepared tenders to greased air-fryer basket and cook at 375°F (190°C) until chicken has reached an internal temperature of 160°F (70°C) and pretzel coating is crunchy, 12 to 18 minutes. Repeat with remaining tenders. Let second batch of tenders rest for 5 minutes.
Serve chicken tenders with reserved honey-mustard sauce for dipping.
Serious Eats / Lorena Masso
Special Equipment
Rimmed baking sheet, wire rack, aluminum foil or parchment paper, food processor or large resealable bag and rolling pin, instant-read thermometer
Notes
You can use pre-prepped chicken tenders (labeled as tenderloins or tenders) or make your own tenders from boneless, skinless chicken breasts. To do so, first remove the tenderloins from the breasts, then cut the breasts lengthwise into 2 to 3 strips of similar thickness (about 2 to 3 ounces; 57 to 85 g each). You should end up with about 8 pieces of chicken.
Make sure to use thin pretzel sticks or thin mini twists, not thick pretzel rods or larger sourdough pretzels, in this recipe.
Make-Ahead and Storage
The honey-mustard mayonnaise can be made ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
The chicken tenders can be frozen, uncooked, for up to 1 month. To freeze, dredge the chicken tenders as directed through the end of step 6, then transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet. Freeze until firm, at least 1 hour, then transfer to a resealable bag or container.
To cook from frozen, bake desired number of tenders directly from frozen, increasing time to 30 to 35 minutes, or cook in the air fryer as directed in recipe, increasing cooking time to 22 to 27 minutes.
